title.narrative: Urban Climate Change Resilience In Cities Along The Greater Mekong Sub-Region East-West Economic Corridor (Ewec) In Lao Pdr

description.narrative:
The proposed project originated as a request from the government of Lao PDR, articulated through MoNRE, for further support in the development of resilient investment in the EWEC area. Thus, the project is in line with the Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) of Laos of the Paris Agreement. Laos’ NDC has five priority areas for adaptation projects; 1) Agriculture, 2) Forestry and Land Use Change, 3) Water Resources, 4) Transport and Urban Development, 5) Public Health. This project aligns with the Transport and Urban Development priority area. It also will provide some support to the mitigation priority area on the implementation of climate change action plans (which include adaptation, but in many cases have not been developed yet).
The proposed project also builds on UN-Habitat’s implementation comparative advantage, acquired through an extensive country programme and history of project implementation is Laos. The project aligns with and complements UN-Habitat’s existing portfolio of projects in Laos. Currently, UN-Habitat is implementing the Climate and Disaster Resilient Rural and Emerging Human Settlements Project in nearby Attapeu, Sekong and Saravan Provinces. Other projects under implementation or recently completed led by UN-Habitat and that are of direct relevance to the proposed GCF Readiness project include the Mekong Region Water and Sanitation Initiative (MEK-WATSAN), the Water for Asian Cities Programme, and the Low Emissions Development project, implemented in conjunction with ICLEI.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office for Project Services

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: A baseline knowledge of climate change and investment patterns developed for the target area

description.narrative: A baseline knowledge of climate change and investment patterns developed for the target area

title.narrative: Stakeholders engaged. Guidelines for coordination mechanisms developed and in place. EWEC area’s development status assessed Assessment and database for EWEC area in Savannakhet developed and available.

description.narrative: Stakeholders engaged. Guidelines for coordination mechanisms developed and in place. EWEC area’s development status assessed Assessment and database for EWEC area in Savannakhet developed and available.

baseline.value: There is limited capacity for government staff to establish successful coordination with private stakeholders in the EWEC area and limited understanding of the link between CC and investment. There is no evidence of previous capacity assessments developed in the area.

target.value: 80 people, between government staff, city-level leaders and private stakeholders engaged with the project. Baseline information available.

title.narrative: Comprehensive low emission & climate change resilient policy and investment roadmap developed to stimulate investment flows

description.narrative: Comprehensive low emission & climate change resilient policy and investment roadmap developed to stimulate investment flows

title.narrative: Documents developed and available, and strategies in place to stimulate investment flows

description.narrative: Documents developed and available, and strategies in place to stimulate investment flows

baseline.value: There is currently no policy or guideline on climate change resilient financial investment in the EWEC and no training has been provided on the topic

target.value: 1 Investment baseline for the EWEC considering CC defined, and 1 Proposal for low emission & climate change resilient policy for the EWEC developed

title.narrative: Country capacity strengthened.Strengthened local and institutional capacity and knowledge for climate resilient urban development and infrastructure

description.narrative: Country capacity strengthened.Strengthened local and institutional capacity and knowledge for climate resilient urban development and infrastructure

title.narrative: A baseline knowledge of climate change and investment patterns developed. Government officers trained to understand climate change and boost resilient investment.

description.narrative: A baseline knowledge of climate change and investment patterns developed. Government officers trained to understand climate change and boost resilient investment.

baseline.value: There is limited capacity for government staff to establish successful coordination with private stakeholders in the EWEC area and limited understanding of the link between CC and investment.

target.value: 80 people, between government staff, city-level leaders and private stakeholders engaged with the project. 40 government staff trained, at least 15 female,for understanding and planning CC action and to advocate for resilient development. Baseline information available.

title.narrative: Local and national government officers trained to understand climate change and plan for action in the context of economic investments in the EWEC in Lao PDR

title.narrative: Workshops conducted and government staff capacities enhanced

description.narrative: Workshops conducted and government staff capacities enhanced

baseline.value: There is very limited capacity at all levels to understand and plan for climate change action and resilient development

target.value: 40 government staff trained, at least 15 female, for understanding and planning CC action and to advocate for resilient development

title.narrative: Private finance and investment climate understood, and opportunities for private finance established and presented

title.narrative: Documents developed and available, and coordination capacities strengthened

description.narrative: Documents developed and available, and coordination capacities strengthened

baseline.value: There is constrained capacity for government staff to establish successful coordination with private stakeholders in the EWEC area and support the development of climate resilient investment

target.value: Resilience building investment opportunities identified. Strategy on how to include public-private investors (considering CC resilience) developed Coordination mechanism between NDA and private sector in place.

title.narrative: Private sector mobilization developed. Government and other actors’ ability enhanced to leverage public and private finance.

description.narrative: Private sector mobilization developed. Government and other actors’ ability enhanced to leverage public and private finance.

title.narrative: Opportunities for private finance established and presented. Policy and investment roadmap developed to stimulate investment flows

description.narrative: Opportunities for private finance established and presented. Policy and investment roadmap developed to stimulate investment flows

baseline.value: Coordination between government and private sector for finance mobilization is weak in the EWEC area, and climate change is not considered when plans are developed

target.value: Resilience building investment opportunities and strategies on public private investment identified. Coordination mechanism in place. 1 Investment baseline for the EWEC considering CC defined, and 1 Proposal for low emission & climate change resilient policy for the EWEC developed
